thread.title: Sacked Sutton keeper Wayne Shaw only ate the pie that got him fired to wind up Arsenal supporters
thread.title_full: Sacked Sutton keeper Wayne Shaw only ate the pie that got him fired to wind up Arsenal supporters

author: ttowers
title: Sacked Sutton keeper Wayne Shaw only ate the pie that got him fired to wind up Arsenal supporters
text:
Opinion 'I ONLY DID IT TO WIND UP GUNNERS' Sacked Sutton keeper Wayne Shaw only ate the pie that got him fired to wind up Arsenal supporters 
Wayne, 46, was forced to quit by Sutton United amid a betting probe over the touchline snack Exclusive Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments SACKED keeper Wayne Shaw last night revealed he only ate his fateful pie to wind up jeering Arsenal supporters — and it ended up giving him indigestion. 
Wayne, 46, forced to quit by Sutton United amid a betting probe over the touchline snack, also insisted no family or pals made any money out of it. Simon Jones/The Sun 16 Shaw was forced to quit by Sutton United amid a betting probe over the touchline snack 
The reserve goalie, who weighs 23st, said he simply wanted to make the crowd laugh towards the end of Sutton’s heroic 2-0 FA Cup defeat on Monday night. 
Speaking exclusively to The Sun, he said: “The Arsenal fans were constantly singing about me, and shouting ‘Who ate all the pies?’ 
“There was a lot of banter, and I thought I could have a bit of fun here. I took a big bite and waved it in the air towards them, but it was all in good spirit.” PA:Press Association He said he simply wanted to make the crowd laugh towards the end of Sutton’s heroic 2-0 FA Cup defeat Rex Features 16 Highlights from Shaw’s career 
The father of two told how he enjoyed it at the time, although he may have eaten it too quickly. 
He said: “It was a meat Cornish pasty — quite nice too. 
“It was probably a good seven out of ten. It could have done with a bit of chilli sauce on it. Sign the petition calling for Wayne’s reinstatement here 
“But it gave me terrible bloody indigestion. It was either the onions or the pastry, or maybe I just chomped it too quick. 
“It didn’t cost me anything from the girl at the counter — apart from my job.” 
SunBets had offered odds of 8-1 that Wayne would eat a pie during the game — then paid out after he was filmed by the BBC scoffing one on the touchline in the 83rd minute. Along with James Corden Reserve keeper Wayne Shaw eats a pie during the match on the Sutton United touchline 
Wayne was then forced to quit his £450-a-week job with the non-league club on Tuesday after the FA and Gambling Commission launched inquiries into the offer. 
His axing sparked outrage among fans , with Match of the Day host Gary Lineker claiming football had “lost its sense of humour”. 
Wayne admitted he was aware of the offer and said people had told him they had placed bets on his pie-eating. 
However, he insisted no close pals or family benefited from it. Simon Jones/The Sun Wayne admitted he was aware of the offer and said people had told him they had placed bets Simon Jones/The Sun However, he insisted no close pals or family benefited from it Sutton United manager speaks as keeper Wayne Shaw resigns over pie betting probe 
He said: “There was no financial gain for myself or anyone I know, friends or family.” 
Wayne said he just got swept up in the “amazing atmosphere” as his beloved Sutton United went toe to toe with the Premier League giants at Gander Green Lane. 
He explained: “It was taken out of context, and it happened in the moment of the game. 
“All the international stars there, it was overwhelming. I wasn’t paid to do it, I didn’t tell anyone I was going to do it. RELATED STORIES SHUT YOUR PIE HOLE! GMB's Susanna Reid warns irate Piers Morgan to 'turn the volume down' after rant about Sutton goalie HUNG OUT TO PIE Celebs lead fans demanding Sutton keeper Wayne Shaw get his job back as he's SACKED by club for eating a pie in the dugout thanks to OTT novelty bet probe after club's Arsenal heroics wayne quits Sutton keeper Wayne Shaw resigns after eating a pie in the dug-out during defeat to Arsenal SCHOOLGIRLS 'ABUSED' Mum and three men accused of 'sex trafficking underage schoolgirls to Travelodge hotels' PASS THE MEGABUCKS Tories slam Blair for 'hospital pass' that led to millions paid out to suspected jihadis SEVEN WONDERS OF THE UNIVERSE Nasa announces discovery of entire solar system which could be home to alien lifeforms 
“It wasn’t done for personal gain. Just something to remember, and it certainly is that now.” 
Wayne said he got the snack earlier but waited until Sutton had used all three of their subs in case he was needed on the pitch. 
He recalled: “I actually got the pasty at half-time, because I was feeling a bit light-headed. Reuters Wayne said he got the snack earlier but waited until Sutton had used all three of their subs Ruckas 16 Shaw rates his favourite pies 
“I felt I didn’t have anything in the tank so I went to caterers, and they offered me a burger or a pasty. I actually wanted a sausage roll. 
“But they gave me the Cornish pasty. I thought I couldn’t eat it straight away as I might get a bit of reflux. That’s why I ended up waiting until all the subs were on. 
I just wanted to have a bit of fun with the supporters who pay their money 
“On reflection, I’ve apologised, it didn’t look good or professional, but what has been done has been done. It got too much for me — the events of the day. Alexis Sanchez and their keeper, David Ospina, came up to me, and I just got carried away.” 
Wayne also claimed he would eat it again — but with the benefit of hindsight do it away from the cameras. Simon Jones/The Sun An online petition to reinstate him has already attracted thousands of supporters Simon Jones/The Sun But Wayne insisted he holds no grudge against anyone at the club Wrestler Grado pays tribute to Sutton keeper Wayne Shaw by eating pie live on Sky Sports 
He said: “Looking back on it, I definitely would still eat the pie. I may have gone inside to eat it but I wanted to be outside soaking up the amazing atmosphere.” 
Wayne is devastated at losing his job at the Surrey club, where he often slept three nights a week. He said: “In more ways than one I do regret it. 
“But only because the joke was taken out of context. I just wanted to have a bit of fun with the supporters who pay their money and like to see a character like me. 
“At Sutton the fans can mingle with the players at the bar, but you saw with Arsenal, there is all the security, you can’t get near them and they are put on a pedestal. It’s been blown out of proportion really.” PA:Press Association He cheered everyone up performing a string of unglamorous roles 
An online petition to reinstate him has already attracted thousands of supporters. 
Good Morning Britain host Piers Morgan also blasted the “pathetic” sacking by the National League minnows and said: “Shame on you Sutton United.” 
But Wayne insisted he holds no grudge against anyone at the club, where he cheered everyone up performing a string of unglamorous roles. He said: “At Sutton, I was the smiley face. I’ve been the goalkeeping coach, then back-up keeper. I used to brush the pitch, work on the online shop, do bits in the community. Getty Images Wayne applauds the crowd after Sutton's heroic defeat against Arsenal Piers Morgan on Sutton United pie-eating goalie Wayne Shaw on Good Morning Britain 
“And I would do any odd jobs in the dressing rooms, help in the bar. I loved it. I used to stay over Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, sleeping on the two-seater sofa in the media room and go back home Thursday.” 
He also loved coaching local kids, saying: “I took to them, they took to me. “They would sing, ‘He’s big, he’s round, he’s worth a million pounds’ — it was humbling really.” 
Wayne has spent the bulk of his career in non-league football — and hopes it’s not over yet. 
He said: “I’d love to stay in the game. Even though I’m 46 and carrying a few extra pounds — I still feel like I’m in my prime. 
“Despite eating all the pies - I’m still fit and mobile. In April I’m doing a triathlon.” The Pie Minister THERESA May joked about Wayne’s antics at PMQs yesterday. 
Tory Paul Scully teed her up, saying Arsenal had allowed “Sutton to keep a little bit of an extra slice of the FA Cup pie”. 
Mrs May praised his “neat reference to pie”, and congratulated Sutton, and fellow non-leaguers Lincoln, on their Cup runs. 
She added: “It is important. It does make a huge difference to local areas when their football club progress to that extent.” Sign the petition calling for Wayne's reinstatement here
